	PRIMARY KEY (`atom_id`, `atom_id2`),

The commonsense evidence is that manaCost is unconverted mana cost. Example values include {X}{R}{R}, {W}{W}{B}{B}{B}{G}{G}, and {5}{R}{R}. #Values Examples: [{5}{W}{W}, {4}{W}, {3}{W}]
	`mcmId` TEXT, -- #The mcmId column in the cards table is a text column that contains the Magic Card Market ID of each card. Example values in this column include 7712, 368267, and 300588. #Values Examples: [16165, 16166, 16171]
	`mcmMetaId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the mcmMetaId of the card. 	`mtgArenaId` TEXT, -- #The mtgArenaId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the mtgArenaId of each card. The mtgArenaId is NOT USEFUL. Example values in this column include 75398, 66663, and 74112. #Values Examples: [None, 74983, 74986]
	`mtgjsonV4Id` TEXT, -- #The mtgjsonV4Id column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of a card in the mtgjsonV4 database. 	`mtgoId` TEXT, -- #The mtgoId column in the cards table is a text column that contains NOT USEFUL values. Example values include 67975, 52320, and 61292. #Values Examples: [27500, 26992, 27472]
	`multiverseId` TEXT, -- #The multiverseId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the multiverse identifier of a card. 	`name` TEXT, -- #The name of the card. Cards with multiple faces, like 'Split' and 'Meld' cards are given a delimiter. Example values include 'Slaughter Pact', 'Crimson Mage', and 'Falkenrath Reaver'. #Values Examples: [Ancestor's Chosen, Angel of Mercy, Aven Cloudchaser]
	`number` TEXT, -- #The number of the card in the cards table. The number column is of type text. Example values include 196, ap100, and 32190. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 7]
	`originalReleaseDate` TEXT, -- #The original Release Date in ISO 8601 format for a promotional card printed outside of a cycle window, such as Secret Lair Drop promotions. 	`originalText` TEXT, -- #The original Text on the cards table is the text on the card as originally printed. Example values include 2007/1/1, 2016/1/7, and 2019/12/1. #Values Examples: [First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen comes into play, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Angel of Mercy comes into play, you gain 3 life., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser comes into play, destroy target enchantment.]
	`originalType` TEXT, -- #The original Type column in the cards table indicates the type of the card as originally printed. Includes any supertypes and subtypes. 	`otherFaceIds` TEXT, -- # otherFaceIds is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of card UUID's to this card's counterparts, such as transformed or melded faces. 	`power` TEXT, -- #The power of the card in the cards table. The power of the card is a text type column. The power of the card is a commonsense evidence:
#â means infinite power
#null or * refers to unknown power. Example values for the power of the card column include 7, 11, and 1. #Values Examples: [4, 3, 2]
	`printings` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column named 'printings' in the 'cards' table of the 'card_games' database. 	`promoTypes` TEXT, -- # Promo Types is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of promotional types for a card. 	`purchaseUrls` TEXT, -- #This column contains links that navigate to websites where the card can be purchased. 	`rarity` TEXT, -- #The card printing rarity. The rarity of the card printing can be one of the following: mythic, rare, common, or uncommon. #Values Examples: [uncommon, common, rare]
	`scryfallId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallId column in the cards table is a text column that contains NOT USEFUL values. 	`scryfallIllustrationId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallIllustrationId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of the card's illustration on Scryfall. 	`scryfallOracleId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallOracleId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of a card in the Scryfall database. The values in this column are not useful for analysis. Example values in this column include ff99337e-410c-43af-9475-7995d690bcef, dff3cfff-69f9-4afd-af28-b75504d30ffa, and 78f50668-36fc-4911-84f7-93667436b0c7. #Values Examples: [fc2ccab7-cab1-4463-b73d-898070136d74, a2daaf32-dbfe-4618-892e-0da24f63a44a, 48bda7dd-d023-41e8-8c28-e0cfda0d07ca]
	`setCode` TEXT, -- #The set printing code that the card is from. For example, the set code for the card 'Goblin Electromancer' is 'GRN'. Other possible values for this column include 'PMEI' and 'M11'. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`side` TEXT, -- #The identifier of the card side. Used on cards with multiple faces on the same card. If this value is empty, then it means this card doesn't have multiple faces on the same card. The possible values are: e, b, a, c, d. #Values Examples: [None, a, b]
	`subtypes` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of card subtypes found after em-dash within the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Efreet,Monk, Rebel,Bird, Barbarian,Zombie. #Values Examples: [Human,Cleric, Angel, Bird,Soldier]
	`supertypes` TEXT, -- #The column 'super types' in the table 'cards' of the database 'card_games' represents a list of card supertypes found before em-dash. The values in this column should be a list of all types, which should be the union of subtypes and supertypes. The possible values for this column are: ['Legendary,Snow', 'World', 'Basic,Snow', 'Ongoing', 'Basic', 'Snow', 'Host', 'Legendary']. #Values Examples: [None, Legendary, Basic]
	`tcgplayerProductId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the TCG player ProductId of each card. The TCG player ProductId is a unique identifier for each card in the TCG player database. Example values include 215487, 184806, and 15212. #Values Examples: [15032, 15033, 15045]
	`text` TEXT, -- #The rules text of the card. This column contains the rules text of the card within the context of the cards table. Example values include 215487, 184806, and 15212. #Values Examples: [First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.]
	`toughness` TEXT, -- #The toughness of the card. The toughness of the card is a text field that represents the toughness of the card. Example values include 11, 7-*, and 14. #Values Examples: [4, 3, 2]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The type of the card as visible, including any supertypes and subtypes. The possible values for this column are 'Artifact', 'Card', 'Conspiracy', 'Creature', 'Dragon', 'Dungeon', 'Eaturecray', 'Elemental', 'Elite', 'Emblem', 'Enchantment', 'Ever', 'Goblin', 'Hero', 'Instant', 'Jaguar', 'Knights', 'Land', 'Phenomenon', 'Plane', 'Planeswalker', 'Scariest', 'Scheme', 'See', 'Sorcery', 'Sticker', 'Summon', 'Token', 'Tribal', 'Vanguard', 'Wolf', 'Youâll', 'instant'. Some example values for this column are 'Creature — Centaur Spellshaper', 'Legendary Creature — Elf Warrior', and 'Snow Creature — Wall'. #Values Examples: [Creature — Human Cleric, Creature — Angel, Creature — Bird Soldier]
	`types` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of all card types of the card, including Unâsets and gameplay variants, in the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Artifact,Creature, Vanguard, and Phenomenon. #Values Examples: [Creature, Instant, Enchantment]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # 'uuid is a text column in cards table. uuid is the universal unique identifier (v5) generated by MTGJSON. Each entry is unique. The example values of uuid are ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d. ' #Values Examples: [00010d56-fe38-5e35-8aed-518019aa36a5, 0001e0d0-2dcd-5640-aadc-a84765cf5fc9, 0003caab-9ff5-5d1a-bc06-976dd0457f19]
	`variations` TEXT, -- #This column is called variations and is of type text. It is a list of unique identifiers for each variation of a card. For example, ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, and 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d are all variations of a card. #Values Examples: [b7c19924-b4bf-56fc-aa73-f586e940bd42, 8fd4e2eb-3eb4-50ea-856b-ef638fa47f8a, 6adaf14d-43e3-521a-adf1-960c808e5b1a]
	`watermark` TEXT, -- #The name of the watermark on the card. This column is a text column in the cards table. Example values include mirran, azorius, and dromoka. #Values Examples: [None, set (HOU), set (LGN)]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`)
);
CREATE TABLE `foreign_data` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- # 'This column is a unique id number identifying this row of data within the 'foreign data' table in the 'card_games' database.' #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`flavorText` TEXT, -- #The foreign flavor text of the card in the foreign data table. Example values include 「この中のどこかに答えがあるはずよ！」, 魔法の刻印が、彫刻師の道具を狼狩りの武器に変えた。, and 'Quando a história se torna demasiado lúgubre, até mesmo almas boas podem escolher esquecer.' — Shalai, voz da Abundância. #Values Examples: [„Es ist der Wille aller, und meine Hand, die ihn ausführt.", "La voluntad de todos, realizada por mi mano.", « La volonté de tous passe par ma main. »]
	`language` TEXT, -- #The foreign language of card. This column contains text data. Example values include Chinese Traditional, Hebrew, and Russian. #Values Examples: [German, Spanish, French]
	`multiverseid` INTEGER, -- #The foreign multiverse identifier of the card. #Values Examples: [148411, 150317, 149934]
	`name` TEXT, -- #The foreign name of the card in the foreign data table. #Values Examples: [Ausgewählter der Ahnfrau, Elegido de la Antepasada, Élu de l'Ancêtre]
	`text` TEXT, -- #This column represents the foreign text ruling of the card within the context of the foreign data table. The text column is of type text. The foreign text ruling of the card is a description of the card's effect in a language other than English. The example values of this column include: 由你操控的衍生生物得+1/+1並具有警戒異能。, 將目標生物移回其擁有者手上。 其操控者失去1點生命。, Metti sul campo di battaglia due pedine creatura Spirito 1/1 bianche con volare. Guadagni 2 punti vita.. The possible values of this column are not available. #Values Examples: [Erstschlag (Diese Kreatur fügt Kampfschaden vor Kreaturen ohne Erstschlag zu.)
Wenn der Ausgewählte der Ahnfrau ins Spiel kommt, erhältst du 1 Lebenspunkt für jede Karte in deinem Friedhof dazu., Daña primero. (Esta criatura hace daño de combate antes que las criaturas sin la habilidad de dañar primero.)
Cuando el Elegido de la Antepasada entre en juego, ganas 1 vida por cada carta en tu cementerio., Initiative (Cette créature inflige des blessures de combat avant les créatures sans l'initiative.)
Quand l'Élu de l'Ancêtre arrive en jeu, vous gagnez 1 point de vie pour chaque carte dans votre cimetière.]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The foreign type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes. The values in this column are text. Example values include Criatura Lendária — Zumbi Naga, Créature : zombie et gobelin, and Kreatur — Zentaur, Druide, Legende. #Values Examples: [Kreatur — Mensch, Kleriker, Criatura — Clérigo humano, Créature : humain et clerc]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column named uuid in the table foreign data. It contains the unique identifier for each row in the table. Example values include 6dbb9aab-c2d9-59dd-8ea3-d954c6a29acf, 2896c920-1b81-526a-b211-a931ba0f4a54, d29d4cc6-e3ab-5986-816c-0fdf2da45c8a. #Values Examples: [5f8287b1-5bb6-5f4c-ad17-316a40d5bb0c, 57aaebc1-850c-503d-9f6e-bb8d00d8bf7c, 8ac972b5-9f6e-5cc8-91c3-b9a40a98232e]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)
);
CREATE TABLE `legalities` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- #This column is a unique identifier for each legality in the legalities table. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`format` TEXT, -- #The format column in the legalities table refers to the format of play. Each value refers to different rules to play. For example, some of the possible values are vintage, future, and modern. #Values Examples: [commander, duel, legacy]
	`status` TEXT, -- #This column represents the status of a card in the context of legalities table. The possible values for this column are legal, banned, and restricted. #Values Examples: [Legal, Banned, Restricted]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # This column is a text column in the legalities table of the card_games database. It contains unique identifiers for each row in the table. Example values include 800243a0-1261-548a-8d9d-3fdf76ebbc66, 89afe3ee-d887-5416-8d0b-e587a3c21f4c, and 81fd1145-e08c-5691-9cd2-78346e0c041f. #Values Examples: [5f8287b1-5bb6-5f4c-ad17-316a40d5bb0c, 57aaebc1-850c-503d-9f6e-bb8d00d8bf7c, 8ac972b5-9f6e-5cc8-91c3-b9a40a98232e]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)
);
CREATE TABLE `sets` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- # 'The id column in the sets table is a unique integer value that identifies each set.' #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`baseSetSize` INTEGER, -- #The base Set Size column in the sets table represents the number of cards in the set. #Values Examples: [383, 302, 332]
	`block` TEXT, -- #This column represents the block name the set was in within the sets table of the card_games database. The values in this column are of type text. Example values include Magic Player Rewards, Battle for Zendikar, and Shadowmoor. #Values Examples: [Core Set, None, Mirrodin]
	`booster` TEXT, -- #This column is called 'booster' and is of type 'text'. It is a breakdown of possibilities and weights of cards in a booster pack. Example values include 'Magic Player Rewards', 'Battle for Zendikar', and 'Shadowmoor'. #Values Examples: [{'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 10, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1913922}, {'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 9, 'foilCommon': 1, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 318987}, {'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 10, , {'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'common': 11, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1}], 'boostersTotalWeight': 1, 'sheets': {'common': {'cards': {'0ab4e3e6-f9fe-5fdc-9697-fd20690a0e15': 1, '0b326a61-0389-54e2-ac58-7bb47ca88202': 1, '0f099574-e9f7-, {'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'common': 8, 'dedicatedFoil2xm': 2, 'rareMythic': 2, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1}], 'boostersTotalWeight': 1, 'sheets': {'common': {'balanceColors': True, 'cards': {'01df4e32-7fe4-5b8d-9460-0f08fa29153e': 1, '032c60]
	`code` TEXT, -- #The set code for the set. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`isFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table of the 'card_games' database. If the set is only available in foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isForeignOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called is Foreign Only and is of type integer. If the set is available only outside the United States of America. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isNonFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Non Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table. If the set is only available in non-foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isOnlineOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Online Only' and is of type 'integer'. If the set is only available in online game variations. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isPartialPreview` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the set is still in preview (spoiled). Preview sets do not have complete data. The data type of this column is integer. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`keyruneCode` TEXT, -- #The matching Keyrune code for set image icons. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`mcmId` INTEGER, -- #The Magic Card Marketset identifier within the context of the sets table. #Values Examples: [74, None, 3204]
	`mcmIdExtras` INTEGER, -- #The split Magic Card Market set identifier if a set is printed in two sets. This identifier represents the second set's identifier. This column is of type integer. #Values Examples: [None, 3209, 3459]
	`mcmName` TEXT, -- #This column represents the name of the set of Magic: The Gathering cards. The name of the set is a string of text. Example values include 'The Dark', 'Champions of Kamigawa', and 'Dark Ascension'. #Values Examples: [Tenth Edition, None, Double Masters]
	`mtgoCode` TEXT, -- #The magic the gathering online code column in the sets table refers to the set code for the set as it appears on Magic: The Gathering Online. If the value is null or empty, then it doesn't appear on Magic: The Gathering Online. Example values include BFZ, PMH1, and UMA. #Values Examples: [10E, None, 2XM]
	`name` TEXT, -- #The name of the set in the card_games sets table. #Values Examples: [Tenth Edition, Unlimited Edition, Double Masters]
	`parentCode` TEXT, -- #The parent set code for set variations like promotions, guild kits, etc. This column is of type text. Example values include PLS, UDS, EVE. #Values Examples: [None, JMP, MH1]
	`releaseDate` DATE, -- #The release date in ISO 8601 format for the set. #Values Examples: [2007-07-13, 1993-12-01, 2020-08-07]
	`tcgplayerGroupId` INTEGER, -- #The TCG player Group Id column in the sets table refers to the group identifier of the set on TCGplayer. #Values Examples: [1, 115, 2655]
	`totalSetSize` INTEGER, -- #The total Set Size is an integer column in the sets table. It represents the total number of cards in the set, including promotional and related supplemental products but excluding Alchemy modifications - however those cards are included in the set itself. #Values Examples: [508, 302, 384]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The expansion type of the set. The type of the set can be 'alchemy', 'archenemy', 'arsenal', 'box', 'commander', 'core', 'draft_innovation', 'duel_deck', 'expansion', 'from_the_vault', 'funny', 'masterpiece', 'masters', 'memorabilia', 'planechase', 'premium_deck', 'promo', 'spellbook', 'starter', 'token', 'treasure_chest', or 'vanguard'. For example, the type of the set can be 'core', 'spellbook', or 'promo'. #Values Examples: [core, masters, expansion]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`)
);
CREATE TABLE `set_translations` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- #This column is a unique id identifying this set within the context of the table 'set translations' in the database 'card_games'. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`language` TEXT, -- #This column represents the language of the card set in the table 'set translations'. The possible values for this column are: Korean, Chinese Simplified, French, Russian, Japanese, Portuguese (Brazil), German, Italian, Chinese Traditional, Spanish. #Values Examples: [Chinese Simplified, Chinese Traditional, French]
	`setCode` TEXT, -- #The set code for this set. The set code is a text field that represents the code for this set. Example values include 9ED, BFZ, and 7ED. #Values Examples: [10E, 4ED, 5DN]
	`translation` TEXT, -- #This column contains the translations of the card set in the table 'set translations' in the 'card_games' database. The data type of this column is text. Example values of this column include 'Exode', 'Kälteeinbruch', and 'Huitième édition'. #Values Examples: [核心系列第十版, Dixième édition, Hauptset Zehnte Edition]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`setCode`) REFERENCES `sets`(`code`)
);

	`layout` TEXT, -- #The type of card layout. For a token card, this will be 'token'. The values of this column include 'leveler', 'vanguard', and 'scheme'. #Values Examples: [normal, aftermath, split]
	`leadershipSkills` TEXT, -- #The leadership Skills column in the cards table is a text column that contains a list of formats the card is legal to be a commander in. Example values include leveler, vanguard, and scheme. #Values Examples: [None, {'brawl': False, 'commander': True, 'oathbreaker': False}, {'brawl': False, 'commander': False, 'oathbreaker': True}]
	`life` TEXT, -- #The starting life total modifier. A plus or minus character precedes an integer. The column contains text data. Example values include: 7, 15, 2. #Values Examples: [None, -5, -1]
	`loyalty` TEXT, -- #The starting loyalty value of the card. Used only on cards with 'Planeswalker' in its types. empty means unkown. Example values: 7, 6, 3. #Values Examples: [None, 6, 3]
	`manaCost` TEXT, -- #The mana Cost column in the cards table represents the mana cost of the card wrapped in brackets for each value. The commonsense evidence is that manaCost is unconverted mana cost. Example values include {X}{R}{R}, {W}{W}{B}{B}{B}{G}{G}, and {5}{R}{R}. #Values Examples: [{5}{W}{W}, {4}{W}, {3}{W}]
	`mcmId` TEXT, -- #The mcmId column in the cards table is a text column that contains the Magic Card Market ID of each card. The Magic Card Market ID is a unique identifier for each card on the Magic Card Market website. The values in this column are not useful for analysis. Example values in this column include 7712, 368267, and 300588. #Values Examples: [16165, 16166, 16171]
	`mcmMetaId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the mcmMetaId of the card. The mcmMetaId is a unique identifier for a card on the Magic Card Market website. The values in this column are not useful. Example values include 4665, 1809, and 207961. #Values Examples: [156, 176, 368]
	`mtgArenaId` TEXT, -- #The mtgArenaId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the mtgArenaId of each card. The mtgArenaId is NOT USEFUL. Example values in this column include 75398, 66663, and 74112. #Values Examples: [None, 74983, 74986]
	`mtgjsonV4Id` TEXT, -- #The mtgjsonV4Id column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of a card in the mtgjsonV4 database. The values in this column are not useful for analysis. 	`mtgoFoilId` TEXT, -- #The mtgoFoilId column in the cards table is a text column that contains NOT USEFUL values. Example values include 25822, 24764, and 21388. #Values Examples: [27501, 26993, 27473]
	`mtgoId` TEXT, -- #The mtgoId column in the cards table is a text column that contains NOT USEFUL values. Example values include 67975, 52320, and 61292. #Values Examples: [27500, 26992, 27472]
	`multiverseId` TEXT, -- #The multiverseId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the multiverse identifier of a card. The multiverse identifier is a unique identifier assigned to a card by the Magic: The Gathering API. The multiverseId column is not useful for analysis purposes. Example values of the multiverseId column include 430415, 271113, and 271184. #Values Examples: [130550, 129465, 129470]
	`name` TEXT, -- #The name of the card. Cards with multiple faces, like 'Split' and 'Meld' cards are given a delimiter. Example values include 'Slaughter Pact', 'Crimson Mage', and 'Falkenrath Reaver'. #Values Examples: [Ancestor's Chosen, Angel of Mercy, Aven Cloudchaser]
	`number` TEXT, -- #The number of the card in the cards table. The number column is of type text. Example values include 196, ap100, and 32190. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 7]
	`originalReleaseDate` TEXT, -- #The original Release Date in ISO 8601 format for a promotional card printed outside of a cycle window, such as Secret Lair Drop promotions. For example, 2007/1/1, 2016/1/7, 2019/12/1 are all valid values for this column. #Values Examples: [None, 2012/12/1, 2006/12/1]
	`originalText` TEXT, -- #The original Text on the cards table is the text on the card as originally printed. Example values include 2007/1/1, 2016/1/7, and 2019/12/1. #Values Examples: [First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen comes into play, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Angel of Mercy comes into play, you gain 3 life., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser comes into play, destroy target enchantment.]
	`originalType` TEXT, -- #The original Type column in the cards table indicates the type of the card as originally printed. Includes any supertypes and subtypes. Example values include Summon - Sliver, Creature — Efreet Monk, and Creature — Human Insect. #Values Examples: [Creature - Human Cleric, Creature - Angel, Creature - Bird Soldier]
	`otherFaceIds` TEXT, -- # otherFaceIds is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of card UUID's to this card's counterparts, such as transformed or melded faces. For example, 9e5fa4dc-893e-5ab3-aa77-f23bbde12f5f, b3615354-6f40-5445-afaa-71f47042fde3, a0aaef0f-9c24-5708-90f9-50fd524cd312 are some of the values in this column. #Values Examples: [None, 87f0062a-8321-5c16-960e-a12ce1df5839, f9f10d34-071c-57a6-b58c-7553abad5c20]
	`power` TEXT, -- #The power of the card in the cards table. The power of the card is a text type column. The power of the card is a commonsense evidence:
#â means infinite power
#null or * refers to unknown power. Example values for the power of the card column include 7, 11, and 1. #Values Examples: [4, 3, 2]
	`printings` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column named 'printings' in the 'cards' table of the 'card_games' database. It contains a list of set printing codes the card was printed in, formatted in uppercase. Example values include 'C17,C20,RTR', 'ATQ', '2ED,3ED,4BB,4ED,5ED,7ED,CED,CEI,DDD,FBB,GVL,ITP,LEA,LEB,M10,RQS,SUM'. #Values Examples: [10E,JUD,UMA, 10E,8ED,9ED,DDC,DVD,IMA,INV,JMP,MB1,P02,PS11,PSAL,S99, 10E,8ED,9ED,ODY]
	`promoTypes` TEXT, -- # Promo Types is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of promotional types for a card. The possible values for this column are 'arenaleague', 'boosterfun', 'boxtopper', 'brawldeck', 'bundle', 'buyabox', 'convention', 'datestamped', 'draculaseries', 'draftweekend', 'duels', 'event', 'fnm', 'gameday', 'gateway', 'giftbox', 'gilded', 'godzillaseries', 'instore', 'intropack', 'jpwalker', 'judgegift', 'league', 'mediainsert', 'neonink', 'openhouse', 'planeswalkerstamped', 'playerrewards', 'playpromo', 'premiereshop', 'prerelease', 'promopack', 'release', 'setpromo', 'stamped', 'textured', 'themepack', 'thick', 'tourney', 'wizardsplaynetwork'. Some example values for this column are 'setpromo,prerelease,datestamped,jpwalker', 'release,buyabox', and 'convention'.<|im_end|> #Values Examples: [None, boxtopper,boosterfun, boosterfun]
	`purchaseUrls` TEXT, -- #This column contains links that navigate to websites where the card can be purchased. Example values include 'setpromo,prerelease,datestamped,jpwalker', 'release,buyabox', and 'convention'. There are no constraints on the values that can be entered into this column. #Values Examples: [{'cardKingdom': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/9fb51af0ad6f0736', 'cardmarket': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/ace8861194ee0b6a', 'tcgplayer': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/4843cea124a0d515'}, {'cardKingdom': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/027095d094e58f5b', 'cardmarket': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/f6fb5098e1cd1b1e', 'tcgplayer': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/56c4b57293f350ef'}, {'cardKingdom': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/9246105d88032a9f', 'cardmarket': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/dcdfe48e6a8f9e1e', 'tcgplayer': 'https://mtgjson.com/links/3ce595aabe276f80'}]
	`rarity` TEXT, -- #The card printing rarity. The rarity of the card printing can be one of the following: mythic, rare, common, or uncommon. #Values Examples: [uncommon, common, rare]
	`scryfallId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallId column in the cards table is a text column that contains NOT USEFUL values. Example values include 6b123efa-8631-4a07-970d-ff4f980a0522, 27dd4893-b18a-4025-9e1b-ed88e376cc15, and d2d50167-e51d-4a27-8bf7-82a7a47114af. #Values Examples: [7a5cd03c-4227-4551-aa4b-7d119f0468b5, 8f7980d4-da43-4d6d-ad16-14b8a34ae91d, 407110e9-19af-4ff5-97b2-c03225031a73]
	`scryfallIllustrationId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallIllustrationId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of the card's illustration on Scryfall. The value of this column is NOT USEFUL. Example values of this column include f5756033-d7b8-4358-abb2-45dfa10b8f6e, eb768ed1-322e-4137-aa58-2b0c7288b505, and 807e5702-d923-4d89-965b-f59f4cd08af4. #Values Examples: [be2f7173-c8b7-4172-a388-9b2c6b3c16e5, e4d6c53f-e936-4be8-8b70-47c2be863b20, 2eb663cd-020a-46d8-a6d9-bb63d4b5c848]
	`scryfallOracleId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallOracleId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of a card in the Scryfall database. The values in this column are not useful for analysis. Example values in this column include ff99337e-410c-43af-9475-7995d690bcef, dff3cfff-69f9-4afd-af28-b75504d30ffa, and 78f50668-36fc-4911-84f7-93667436b0c7. #Values Examples: [fc2ccab7-cab1-4463-b73d-898070136d74, a2daaf32-dbfe-4618-892e-0da24f63a44a, 48bda7dd-d023-41e8-8c28-e0cfda0d07ca]
	`setCode` TEXT, -- #The set printing code that the card is from. For example, the set code for the card 'Goblin Electromancer' is 'GRN'. Other possible values for this column include 'PMEI' and 'M11'. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`side` TEXT, -- #The identifier of the card side. Used on cards with multiple faces on the same card. If this value is empty, then it means this card doesn't have multiple faces on the same card. The possible values are: e, b, a, c, d. #Values Examples: [None, a, b]
	`subtypes` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of card subtypes found after em-dash within the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Efreet,Monk, Rebel,Bird, Barbarian,Zombie. #Values Examples: [Human,Cleric, Angel, Bird,Soldier]
	`supertypes` TEXT, -- #The column 'super types' in the table 'cards' of the database 'card_games' represents a list of card supertypes found before em-dash. The values in this column should be a list of all types, which should be the union of subtypes and supertypes. The possible values for this column are: ['Legendary,Snow', 'World', 'Basic,Snow', 'Ongoing', 'Basic', 'Snow', 'Host', 'Legendary']. #Values Examples: [None, Legendary, Basic]
	`tcgplayerProductId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the TCG player ProductId of each card. The TCG player ProductId is a unique identifier for each card in the TCG player database. Example values include 215487, 184806, and 15212. #Values Examples: [15032, 15033, 15045]
	`text` TEXT, -- #The rules text of the card. This column contains the rules text of the card within the context of the cards table. Example values include 215487, 184806, and 15212. #Values Examples: [First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard., Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.]
	`toughness` TEXT, -- #The toughness of the card. The toughness of the card is a text field that represents the toughness of the card. Example values include 11, 7-*, and 14. #Values Examples: [4, 3, 2]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The type of the card as visible, including any supertypes and subtypes. The possible values for this column are 'Artifact', 'Card', 'Conspiracy', 'Creature', 'Dragon', 'Dungeon', 'Eaturecray', 'Elemental', 'Elite', 'Emblem', 'Enchantment', 'Ever', 'Goblin', 'Hero', 'Instant', 'Jaguar', 'Knights', 'Land', 'Phenomenon', 'Plane', 'Planeswalker', 'Scariest', 'Scheme', 'See', 'Sorcery', 'Sticker', 'Summon', 'Token', 'Tribal', 'Vanguard', 'Wolf', 'Youâll', 'instant'. Some example values for this column are 'Creature — Centaur Spellshaper', 'Legendary Creature — Elf Warrior', and 'Snow Creature — Wall'. #Values Examples: [Creature — Human Cleric, Creature — Angel, Creature — Bird Soldier]
	`types` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of all card types of the card, including Unâsets and gameplay variants, in the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Artifact,Creature, Vanguard, and Phenomenon. #Values Examples: [Creature, Instant, Enchantment]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # 'uuid is a text column in cards table. uuid is the universal unique identifier (v5) generated by MTGJSON. Each entry is unique. The example values of uuid are ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d. ' #Values Examples: [00010d56-fe38-5e35-8aed-518019aa36a5, 0001e0d0-2dcd-5640-aadc-a84765cf5fc9, 0003caab-9ff5-5d1a-bc06-976dd0457f19]
	`variations` TEXT, -- #This column is called variations and is of type text. It is a list of unique identifiers for each variation of a card. For example, ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, and 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d are all variations of a card. #Values Examples: [b7c19924-b4bf-56fc-aa73-f586e940bd42, 8fd4e2eb-3eb4-50ea-856b-ef638fa47f8a, 6adaf14d-43e3-521a-adf1-960c808e5b1a]
	`watermark` TEXT, -- #The name of the watermark on the card. This column is a text column in the cards table. Example values include mirran, azorius, and dromoka. #Values Examples: [None, set (HOU), set (LGN)]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`)
);
CREATE TABLE `foreign_data` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- # 'This column is a unique id number identifying this row of data within the 'foreign data' table in the 'card_games' database.' #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`flavorText` TEXT, -- #The foreign flavor text of the card in the foreign data table. Example values include 「この中のどこかに答えがあるはずよ！」, 魔法の刻印が、彫刻師の道具を狼狩りの武器に変えた。, and 'Quando a história se torna demasiado lúgubre, até mesmo almas boas podem escolher esquecer.' — Shalai, voz da Abundância. #Values Examples: [„Es ist der Wille aller, und meine Hand, die ihn ausführt.", "La voluntad de todos, realizada por mi mano.", « La volonté de tous passe par ma main. »]
	`language` TEXT, -- #The foreign language of card. This column contains text data. Example values include Chinese Traditional, Hebrew, and Russian. #Values Examples: [German, Spanish, French]
	`multiverseid` INTEGER, -- #The foreign multiverse identifier of the card. #Values Examples: [148411, 150317, 149934]
	`name` TEXT, -- #The foreign name of the card in the foreign data table. #Values Examples: [Ausgewählter der Ahnfrau, Elegido de la Antepasada, Élu de l'Ancêtre]
	`text` TEXT, -- #This column represents the foreign text ruling of the card within the context of the foreign data table. The text column is of type text. The foreign text ruling of the card is a description of the card's effect in a language other than English. The example values of this column include: 由你操控的衍生生物得+1/+1並具有警戒異能。, 將目標生物移回其擁有者手上。 其操控者失去1點生命。, Metti sul campo di battaglia due pedine creatura Spirito 1/1 bianche con volare. Guadagni 2 punti vita.. The possible values of this column are not available. #Values Examples: [Erstschlag (Diese Kreatur fügt Kampfschaden vor Kreaturen ohne Erstschlag zu.)
Wenn der Ausgewählte der Ahnfrau ins Spiel kommt, erhältst du 1 Lebenspunkt für jede Karte in deinem Friedhof dazu., Daña primero. (Esta criatura hace daño de combate antes que las criaturas sin la habilidad de dañar primero.)
Cuando el Elegido de la Antepasada entre en juego, ganas 1 vida por cada carta en tu cementerio., Initiative (Cette créature inflige des blessures de combat avant les créatures sans l'initiative.)
Quand l'Élu de l'Ancêtre arrive en jeu, vous gagnez 1 point de vie pour chaque carte dans votre cimetière.]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The foreign type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes. The values in this column are text. Example values include Criatura Lendária — Zumbi Naga, Créature : zombie et gobelin, and Kreatur — Zentaur, Druide, Legende. #Values Examples: [Kreatur — Mensch, Kleriker, Criatura — Clérigo humano, Créature : humain et clerc]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column named uuid in the table foreign data. It contains the unique identifier for each row in the table. Example values include 6dbb9aab-c2d9-59dd-8ea3-d954c6a29acf, 2896c920-1b81-526a-b211-a931ba0f4a54, d29d4cc6-e3ab-5986-816c-0fdf2da45c8a. #Values Examples: [5f8287b1-5bb6-5f4c-ad17-316a40d5bb0c, 57aaebc1-850c-503d-9f6e-bb8d00d8bf7c, 8ac972b5-9f6e-5cc8-91c3-b9a40a98232e]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)
);
CREATE TABLE `legalities` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- #This column is a unique identifier for each legality in the legalities table. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`format` TEXT, -- #The format column in the legalities table refers to the format of play. Each value refers to different rules to play. For example, some of the possible values are vintage, future, and modern. #Values Examples: [commander, duel, legacy]
	`status` TEXT, -- #This column represents the status of a card in the context of legalities table. The possible values for this column are legal, banned, and restricted. #Values Examples: [Legal, Banned, Restricted]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # This column is a text column in the legalities table of the card_games database. It contains unique identifiers for each row in the table. Example values include 800243a0-1261-548a-8d9d-3fdf76ebbc66, 89afe3ee-d887-5416-8d0b-e587a3c21f4c, and 81fd1145-e08c-5691-9cd2-78346e0c041f. #Values Examples: [5f8287b1-5bb6-5f4c-ad17-316a40d5bb0c, 57aaebc1-850c-503d-9f6e-bb8d00d8bf7c, 8ac972b5-9f6e-5cc8-91c3-b9a40a98232e]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)
);
CREATE TABLE `sets` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- # 'The id column in the sets table is a unique integer value that identifies each set.' #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`baseSetSize` INTEGER, -- #The base Set Size column in the sets table represents the number of cards in the set. #Values Examples: [383, 302, 332]
	`block` TEXT, -- #This column represents the block name the set was in within the sets table of the card_games database. The values in this column are of type text. Example values include Magic Player Rewards, Battle for Zendikar, and Shadowmoor. #Values Examples: [Core Set, None, Mirrodin]
	`booster` TEXT, -- #This column is called 'booster' and is of type 'text'. It is a breakdown of possibilities and weights of cards in a booster pack. Example values include 'Magic Player Rewards', 'Battle for Zendikar', and 'Shadowmoor'. #Values Examples: [{'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 10, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1913922}, {'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 9, 'foilCommon': 1, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 318987}, {'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 10, , {'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'common': 11, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1}], 'boostersTotalWeight': 1, 'sheets': {'common': {'cards': {'0ab4e3e6-f9fe-5fdc-9697-fd20690a0e15': 1, '0b326a61-0389-54e2-ac58-7bb47ca88202': 1, '0f099574-e9f7-, {'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'common': 8, 'dedicatedFoil2xm': 2, 'rareMythic': 2, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1}], 'boostersTotalWeight': 1, 'sheets': {'common': {'balanceColors': True, 'cards': {'01df4e32-7fe4-5b8d-9460-0f08fa29153e': 1, '032c60]
	`code` TEXT, -- #The set code for the set. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`isFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table of the 'card_games' database. If the set is only available in foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isForeignOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called is Foreign Only and is of type integer. If the set is available only outside the United States of America. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isNonFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Non Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table. If the set is only available in non-foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isOnlineOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Online Only' and is of type 'integer'. If the set is only available in online game variations. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isPartialPreview` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the set is still in preview (spoiled). Preview sets do not have complete data. The data type of this column is integer. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`keyruneCode` TEXT, -- #The matching Keyrune code for set image icons. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`mcmId` INTEGER, -- #The Magic Card Marketset identifier within the context of the sets table. #Values Examples: [74, None, 3204]
	`mcmIdExtras` INTEGER, -- #The split Magic Card Market set identifier if a set is printed in two sets. This identifier represents the second set's identifier. This column is of type integer. #Values Examples: [None, 3209, 3459]
	`mcmName` TEXT, -- #This column represents the name of the set of Magic: The Gathering cards. The name of the set is a string of text. Example values include 'The Dark', 'Champions of Kamigawa', and 'Dark Ascension'. #Values Examples: [Tenth Edition, None, Double Masters]
	`mtgoCode` TEXT, -- #The magic the gathering online code column in the sets table refers to the set code for the set as it appears on Magic: The Gathering Online. If the value is null or empty, then it doesn't appear on Magic: The Gathering Online. Example values include BFZ, PMH1, and UMA. #Values Examples: [10E, None, 2XM]
	`name` TEXT, -- #The name of the set in the card_games sets table. #Values Examples: [Tenth Edition, Unlimited Edition, Double Masters]
	`parentCode` TEXT, -- #The parent set code for set variations like promotions, guild kits, etc. This column is of type text. Example values include PLS, UDS, EVE. #Values Examples: [None, JMP, MH1]
	`releaseDate` DATE, -- #The release date in ISO 8601 format for the set. #Values Examples: [2007-07-13, 1993-12-01, 2020-08-07]
	`tcgplayerGroupId` INTEGER, -- #The TCG player Group Id column in the sets table refers to the group identifier of the set on TCGplayer. #Values Examples: [1, 115, 2655]
	`totalSetSize` INTEGER, -- #The total Set Size is an integer column in the sets table. It represents the total number of cards in the set, including promotional and related supplemental products but excluding Alchemy modifications - however those cards are included in the set itself. #Values Examples: [508, 302, 384]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The expansion type of the set. The type of the set can be 'alchemy', 'archenemy', 'arsenal', 'box', 'commander', 'core', 'draft_innovation', 'duel_deck', 'expansion', 'from_the_vault', 'funny', 'masterpiece', 'masters', 'memorabilia', 'planechase', 'premium_deck', 'promo', 'spellbook', 'starter', 'token', 'treasure_chest', or 'vanguard'. For example, the type of the set can be 'core', 'spellbook', or 'promo'. #Values Examples: [core, masters, expansion]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`)
);
CREATE TABLE `set_translations` (

	`isReserved` INTEGER, -- #If the card is on the Magic: The Gathering Reserved List (opens new window), If the card is on the Magic, it will appear in The Gathering Reserved List #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isStarter` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card is found in a starter deck such as Planeswalker/Brawl decks. The value of this column is an integer, and 0 indicates that the card is not found in a starter deck, while 1 indicates that the card is found in a starter deck. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isStorySpotlight` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Story Spotlight' and it is of type 'integer'. It represents whether the card is a Story Spotlight card. The value of this column can be either 0 or 1. 0 means the card is not a Story Spotlight card, and 1 means the card is a Story Spotlight card. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isTextless` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Text less' and it is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'cards' table. The column indicates whether the card has a text box or not. The value of 0 indicates that the card has a text box, while the value of 1 indicates that the card does not have a text box. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isTimeshifted` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Time shifted' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'cards' table of the 'card_games' database. If the card is time shifted, a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion. The value of this column is either 0 or 1. If the card is 'timeshifted', a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`keywords` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of keywords found on the card within the context of the cards table in the card_games database. The column is of type text. Example values include: ['Deathtouch,Delve', 'Flying,Myriad,Vigilance', 'Flying,Mill,Unearth']. #Values Examples: [First strike, Flying, None]
	`layout` TEXT, -- #The type of card layout. For a token card, this will be 'token'. The values of this column include 'leveler', 'vanguard', and 'scheme'. #Values Examples: [normal, aftermath, split]
	`leadershipSkills` TEXT, -- #The leadership Skills column in the cards table is a text column that contains a list of formats the card is legal to be a commander in. Example values include leveler, vanguard, and scheme. #Values Examples: [None, {'brawl': False, 'commander': True, 'oathbreaker': False}, {'brawl': False, 'commander': False, 'oathbreaker': True}]
	`life` TEXT, -- #The starting life total modifier. A plus or minus character precedes an integer. The column contains text data. Example values include: 7, 15, 2. #Values Examples: [None, -5, -1]
	`loyalty` TEXT, -- #The starting loyalty value of the card. Used only on cards with 'Planeswalker' in its types. empty means unkown. Example values: 7, 6, 3. #Values Examples: [None, 6, 3]
	`manaCost` TEXT, -- #The mana Cost column in the cards table represents the mana cost of the card wrapped in brackets for each value. The commonsense evidence is that manaCost is unconverted mana cost. Example values include {X}{R}{R}, {W}{W}{B}{B}{B}{G}{G}, and {5}{R}{R}. #Values Examples: [{5}{W}{W}, {4}{W}, {3}{W}]
	`mcmId` TEXT, -- #The mcmId column in the cards table is a text column that contains the Magic Card Market ID of each card. The Magic Card Market ID is a unique identifier for each card on the Magic Card Market website. The values in this column are not useful for analysis. Example values in this column include 7712, 368267, and 300588. #Values Examples: [16165, 16166, 16171]
	`mcmMetaId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the mcmMetaId of the card. Example values include 4665, 1809, and 207961. #Values Examples: [156, 176, 368]
	`mtgArenaId` TEXT, -- #The mtgArenaId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the mtgArenaId of each card. The mtgArenaId is NOT USEFUL. Example values in this column include 75398, 66663, and 74112. #Values Examples: [None, 74983, 74986]
	`mtgjsonV4Id` TEXT, -- #The mtgjsonV4Id column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of a card in the mtgjsonV4 database. 	`mtgoId` TEXT, -- #The mtgoId column in the cards table is a text column that contains NOT USEFUL values. Example values include 67975, 52320, and 61292. #Values Examples: [27500, 26992, 27472]
	`multiverseId` TEXT, -- #The multiverseId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the multiverse identifier of a card. 	`name` TEXT, -- #The name of the card. Cards with multiple faces, like 'Split' and 'Meld' cards are given a delimiter. Example values include 'Slaughter Pact', 'Crimson Mage', and 'Falkenrath Reaver'. #Values Examples: [Ancestor's Chosen, Angel of Mercy, Aven Cloudchaser]
	`number` TEXT, -- #The number of the card in the cards table. The number column is of type text. Example values include 196, ap100, and 32190. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 7]
	`originalReleaseDate` TEXT, -- #The original Release Date in ISO 8601 format for a promotional card printed outside of a cycle window, such as Secret Lair Drop promotions. 	`originalText` TEXT, -- #The original Text on the cards table is the text on the card as originally printed. Example values include 2007/1/1, 2016/1/7, and 2019/12/1. #Values Examples: [First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Ancestor's Chosen comes into play, you gain 1 life for each card in your graveyard., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Angel of Mercy comes into play, you gain 3 life., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser comes into play, destroy target enchantment.]
	`originalType` TEXT, -- #The original Type column in the cards table indicates the type of the card as originally printed. Includes any supertypes and subtypes. 	`otherFaceIds` TEXT, -- # otherFaceIds is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of card UUID's to this card's counterparts, such as transformed or melded faces. 	`power` TEXT, -- #The power of the card in the cards table. The power of the card is a text type column. The power of the card is a commonsense evidence:
#â means infinite power
#null or * refers to unknown power. Example values for the power of the card column include 7, 11, and 1. #Values Examples: [4, 3, 2]
	`printings` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column named 'printings' in the 'cards' table of the 'card_games' database. 	`promoTypes` TEXT, -- # Promo Types is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of promotional types for a card. Some example values for this column are 'setpromo,prerelease,datestamped,jpwalker', 'release,buyabox', and 'convention'.<|im_end|> #Values Examples: [None, boxtopper,boosterfun, boosterfun]
	`purchaseUrls` TEXT, -- #This column contains links that navigate to websites where the card can be purchased. 	`rarity` TEXT, -- #The card printing rarity. The rarity of the card printing can be one of the following: mythic, rare, common, or uncommon. #Values Examples: [uncommon, common, rare]
	`scryfallId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallId column in the cards table is a text column that contains NOT USEFUL values. 	`scryfallIllustrationId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallIllustrationId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of the card's illustration on Scryfall. 	`scryfallOracleId` TEXT, -- #The scryfallOracleId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of a card in the Scryfall database. The values in this column are not useful for analysis. Example values in this column include ff99337e-410c-43af-9475-7995d690bcef, dff3cfff-69f9-4afd-af28-b75504d30ffa, and 78f50668-36fc-4911-84f7-93667436b0c7. #Values Examples: [fc2ccab7-cab1-4463-b73d-898070136d74, a2daaf32-dbfe-4618-892e-0da24f63a44a, 48bda7dd-d023-41e8-8c28-e0cfda0d07ca]
	`setCode` TEXT, -- #The set printing code that the card is from. For example, the set code for the card 'Goblin Electromancer' is 'GRN'. Other possible values for this column include 'PMEI' and 'M11'. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`side` TEXT, -- #The identifier of the card side. Used on cards with multiple faces on the same card. If this value is empty, then it means this card doesn't have multiple faces on the same card. The possible values are: e, b, a, c, d. #Values Examples: [None, a, b]
	`subtypes` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of card subtypes found after em-dash within the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Efreet,Monk, Rebel,Bird, Barbarian,Zombie. #Values Examples: [Human,Cleric, Angel, Bird,Soldier]
	`supertypes` TEXT, -- #The column 'super types' in the table 'cards' of the database 'card_games' represents a list of card supertypes found before em-dash. The values in this column should be a list of all types, which should be the union of subtypes and supertypes. 	`tcgplayerProductId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the TCG player ProductId of each card. The TCG player ProductId is a unique identifier for each card in the TCG player database. Example values include 215487, 184806, and 15212. #Values Examples: [15032, 15033, 15045]
	`text` TEXT, -- #The rules text of the card. This column contains the rules text of the card within the context of the cards table. Example values include 215487, 184806, and 15212. #Values Examples: [First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life., Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.]
	`toughness` TEXT, -- #The toughness of the card. The toughness of the card is a text field that represents the toughness of the card. Example values include 11, 7-*, and 14. #Values Examples: [4, 3, 2]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The type of the card as visible, including any supertypes and subtypes. The possible values for this column are 'Artifact', 'Card', 'Conspiracy', 'Creature', 'Dragon', 'Dungeon', 'Eaturecray', 'Elemental', 'Elite', 'Emblem', 'Enchantment', 'Ever', 'Goblin', 'Hero', 'Instant', 'Jaguar', 'Knights', 'Land', 'Phenomenon', 'Plane', 'Planeswalker', 'Scariest', 'Scheme', 'See', 'Sorcery', 'Sticker', 'Summon', 'Token', 'Tribal', 'Vanguard', 'Wolf', 'Youâll', 'instant'. Some example values for this column are 'Creature — Centaur Spellshaper', 'Legendary Creature — Elf Warrior', and 'Snow Creature — Wall'. #Values Examples: [Creature — Human Cleric, Creature — Angel, Creature — Bird Soldier]
	`types` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of all card types of the card, including Unâsets and gameplay variants, in the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Artifact,Creature, Vanguard, and Phenomenon. #Values Examples: [Creature, Instant, Enchantment]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # 'uuid is a text column in cards table. uuid is the universal unique identifier (v5) generated by MTGJSON. Each entry is unique. The example values of uuid are ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d. ' #Values Examples: [00010d56-fe38-5e35-8aed-518019aa36a5, 0001e0d0-2dcd-5640-aadc-a84765cf5fc9, 0003caab-9ff5-5d1a-bc06-976dd0457f19]
	`variations` TEXT, -- #This column is called variations and is of type text. It is a list of unique identifiers for each variation of a card. For example, ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, and 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d are all variations of a card. #Values Examples: [b7c19924-b4bf-56fc-aa73-f586e940bd42, 8fd4e2eb-3eb4-50ea-856b-ef638fa47f8a, 6adaf14d-43e3-521a-adf1-960c808e5b1a]
	`watermark` TEXT, -- #The name of the watermark on the card. This column is a text column in the cards table. Example values include mirran, azorius, and dromoka. #Values Examples: [None, set (HOU), set (LGN)]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`)
);
CREATE TABLE `foreign_data` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- # 'This column is a unique id number identifying this row of data within the 'foreign data' table in the 'card_games' database.' #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`flavorText` TEXT, -- #The foreign flavor text of the card in the foreign data table. Example values include 「この中のどこかに答えがあるはずよ！」, 魔法の刻印が、彫刻師の道具を狼狩りの武器に変えた。, and 'Quando a história se torna demasiado lúgubre, até mesmo almas boas podem escolher esquecer.' — Shalai, voz da Abundância. #Values Examples: [„Es ist der Wille aller, und meine Hand, die ihn ausführt.", "La voluntad de todos, realizada por mi mano.", « La volonté de tous passe par ma main. »]
	`language` TEXT, -- #The foreign language of card. This column contains text data. Example values include Chinese Traditional, Hebrew, and Russian. #Values Examples: [German, Spanish, French]
	`multiverseid` INTEGER, -- #The foreign multiverse identifier of the card. #Values Examples: [148411, 150317, 149934]
	`name` TEXT, -- #The foreign name of the card in the foreign data table. #Values Examples: [Ausgewählter der Ahnfrau, Elegido de la Antepasada, Élu de l'Ancêtre]
	`text` TEXT, -- #This column represents the foreign text ruling of the card within the context of the foreign data table. The text column is of type text. The foreign text ruling of the card is a description of the card's effect in a language other than English. The example values of this column include: 由你操控的衍生生物得+1/+1並具有警戒異能。, 將目標生物移回其擁有者手上。 其操控者失去1點生命。, Metti sul campo di battaglia due pedine creatura Spirito 1/1 bianche con volare. Guadagni 2 punti vita.. The possible values of this column are not available. #Values Examples: [Erstschlag (Diese Kreatur fügt Kampfschaden vor Kreaturen ohne Erstschlag zu.)
Wenn der Ausgewählte der Ahnfrau ins Spiel kommt, erhältst du 1 Lebenspunkt für jede Karte in deinem Friedhof dazu., Daña primero. (Esta criatura hace daño de combate antes que las criaturas sin la habilidad de dañar primero.)
Cuando el Elegido de la Antepasada entre en juego, ganas 1 vida por cada carta en tu cementerio., Initiative (Cette créature inflige des blessures de combat avant les créatures sans l'initiative.)
Quand l'Élu de l'Ancêtre arrive en jeu, vous gagnez 1 point de vie pour chaque carte dans votre cimetière.]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The foreign type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes. The values in this column are text. Example values include Criatura Lendária — Zumbi Naga, Créature : zombie et gobelin, and Kreatur — Zentaur, Druide, Legende. #Values Examples: [Kreatur — Mensch, Kleriker, Criatura — Clérigo humano, Créature : humain et clerc]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column named uuid in the table foreign data. It contains the unique identifier for each row in the table. Example values include 6dbb9aab-c2d9-59dd-8ea3-d954c6a29acf, 2896c920-1b81-526a-b211-a931ba0f4a54, d29d4cc6-e3ab-5986-816c-0fdf2da45c8a. #Values Examples: [5f8287b1-5bb6-5f4c-ad17-316a40d5bb0c, 57aaebc1-850c-503d-9f6e-bb8d00d8bf7c, 8ac972b5-9f6e-5cc8-91c3-b9a40a98232e]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)
);
CREATE TABLE `legalities` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- #This column is a unique identifier for each legality in the legalities table. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`format` TEXT, -- #The format column in the legalities table refers to the format of play. Each value refers to different rules to play. For example, some of the possible values are vintage, future, and modern. #Values Examples: [commander, duel, legacy]
	`status` TEXT, -- #This column represents the status of a card in the context of legalities table. The possible values for this column are legal, banned, and restricted. #Values Examples: [Legal, Banned, Restricted]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # This column is a text column in the legalities table of the card_games database. It contains unique identifiers for each row in the table. Example values include 800243a0-1261-548a-8d9d-3fdf76ebbc66, 89afe3ee-d887-5416-8d0b-e587a3c21f4c, and 81fd1145-e08c-5691-9cd2-78346e0c041f. #Values Examples: [5f8287b1-5bb6-5f4c-ad17-316a40d5bb0c, 57aaebc1-850c-503d-9f6e-bb8d00d8bf7c, 8ac972b5-9f6e-5cc8-91c3-b9a40a98232e]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)
);
CREATE TABLE `sets` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- # 'The id column in the sets table is a unique integer value that identifies each set.' #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`baseSetSize` INTEGER, -- #The base Set Size column in the sets table represents the number of cards in the set. #Values Examples: [383, 302, 332]
	`block` TEXT, -- #This column represents the block name the set was in within the sets table of the card_games database. The values in this column are of type text. Example values include Magic Player Rewards, Battle for Zendikar, and Shadowmoor. #Values Examples: [Core Set, None, Mirrodin]
	`booster` TEXT, -- #This column is called 'booster' and is of type 'text'. It is a breakdown of possibilities and weights of cards in a booster pack. Example values include 'Magic Player Rewards', 'Battle for Zendikar', and 'Shadowmoor'. #Values Examples: [{'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 10, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1913922}, {'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 9, 'foilCommon': 1, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 318987}, {'contents': {'basic': 1, 'common': 10, , {'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'common': 11, 'rare': 1, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1}], 'boostersTotalWeight': 1, 'sheets': {'common': {'cards': {'0ab4e3e6-f9fe-5fdc-9697-fd20690a0e15': 1, '0b326a61-0389-54e2-ac58-7bb47ca88202': 1, '0f099574-e9f7-, {'default': {'boosters': [{'contents': {'common': 8, 'dedicatedFoil2xm': 2, 'rareMythic': 2, 'uncommon': 3}, 'weight': 1}], 'boostersTotalWeight': 1, 'sheets': {'common': {'balanceColors': True, 'cards': {'01df4e32-7fe4-5b8d-9460-0f08fa29153e': 1, '032c60]
	`code` TEXT, -- #The set code for the set. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`isFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table of the 'card_games' database. If the set is only available in foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isForeignOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called is Foreign Only and is of type integer. If the set is available only outside the United States of America. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isNonFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Non Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table. If the set is only available in non-foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isOnlineOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Online Only' and is of type 'integer'. If the set is only available in online game variations. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isPartialPreview` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the set is still in preview (spoiled). Preview sets do not have complete data. The data type of this column is integer. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`keyruneCode` TEXT, -- #The matching Keyrune code for set image icons. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`mcmId` INTEGER, -- #The Magic Card Marketset identifier within the context of the sets table. #Values Examples: [74, None, 3204]

	`isPromo` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Promotion' and it is of type 'integer'. It represents whether the card is a promotional printing. The value of 0 means the card is not a promotional printing, while the value of 1 means the card is a promotional printing. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isReprint` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card has been reprinted or not. The value of this column is an integer. If the value is 0, it means that the card has not been reprinted. If the value is 1, it means that the card has been reprinted. #Values Examples: [1, 0]
	`isReserved` INTEGER, -- #If the card is on the Magic: The Gathering Reserved List (opens new window), If the card is on the Magic, it will appear in The Gathering Reserved List #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isStarter` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card is found in a starter deck such as Planeswalker/Brawl decks. The value of this column is an integer, and 0 indicates that the card is not found in a starter deck, while 1 indicates that the card is found in a starter deck. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isStorySpotlight` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Story Spotlight' and it is of type 'integer'. It represents whether the card is a Story Spotlight card. The value of this column can be either 0 or 1. 0 means the card is not a Story Spotlight card, and 1 means the card is a Story Spotlight card. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isTextless` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Text less' and it is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'cards' table. The column indicates whether the card has a text box or not. The value of 0 indicates that the card has a text box, while the value of 1 indicates that the card does not have a text box. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isTimeshifted` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Time shifted' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'cards' table of the 'card_games' database. If the card is time shifted, a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion. The value of this column is either 0 or 1. If the card is 'timeshifted', a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`keywords` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of keywords found on the card within the context of the cards table in the card_games database. The column is of type text. Example values include: ['Deathtouch,Delve', 'Flying,Myriad,Vigilance', 'Flying,Mill,Unearth']. #Values Examples: [First strike, Flying, None]
	`layout` TEXT, -- #The type of card layout. For a token card, this will be 'token'. The values of this column include 'leveler', 'vanguard', and 'scheme'. #Values Examples: [normal, aftermath, split]
	`leadershipSkills` TEXT, -- #The leadership Skills column in the cards table is a text column that contains a list of formats the card is legal to be a commander in. 	`life` TEXT, -- #The starting life total modifier. A plus or minus character precedes an integer. The column contains text data. Example values include: 7, 15, 2. #Values Examples: [None, -5, -1]
	`loyalty` TEXT, -- #The starting loyalty value of the card. Used only on cards with 'Planeswalker' in its types. empty means unkown. Example values: 7, 6, 3. #Values Examples: [None, 6, 3]
	`manaCost` TEXT, -- #The mana Cost column in the cards table represents the mana cost of the card wrapped in brackets for each value. The commonsense evidence is that manaCost is unconverted mana cost. Example values include {X}{R}{R}, {W}{W}{B}{B}{B}{G}{G}, and {5}{R}{R}. #Values Examples: [{5}{W}{W}, {4}{W}, {3}{W}]
	`mcmId` TEXT, -- #The mcmId column in the cards table is a text column that contains the Magic Card Market ID of each card. Example values in this column include 7712, 368267, and 300588. #Values Examples: [16165, 16166, 16171]
	`mcmMetaId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the mcmMetaId of the card. Example values include 4665, 1809, and 207961. #Values Examples: [156, 176, 368]
	`mtgArenaId` TEXT, -- #The mtgArenaId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the mtgArenaId of each card. The mtgArenaId is NOT USEFUL. Example values in this column include 75398, 66663, and 74112. #Values Examples: [None, 74983, 74986]
	`mtgjsonV4Id` TEXT, -- #The mtgjsonV4Id column in the cards table is a text column that stores the unique identifier of a card in the mtgjsonV4 database. 	`multiverseId` TEXT, -- #The multiverseId column in the cards table is a text column that stores the multiverse identifier of a card. 	`name` TEXT, -- #The name of the card. Cards with multiple faces, like 'Split' and 'Meld' cards are given a delimiter. Example values include 'Slaughter Pact', 'Crimson Mage', and 'Falkenrath Reaver'. #Values Examples: [Ancestor's Chosen, Angel of Mercy, Aven Cloudchaser]
	`number` TEXT, -- #The number of the card in the cards table. The number column is of type text. Example values include 196, ap100, and 32190. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 7]

	`originalText` TEXT, -- #The original Text on the cards table is the text on the card as originally printed. Example values include 2007/1/1, 2016/1/7, and 2019/12/1. #Values Examples: [First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

	`otherFaceIds` TEXT, -- # otherFaceIds is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of card UUID's to this card's counterparts, such as transformed or melded faces. 	`power` TEXT, -- #The power of the card in the cards table. The power of the card is a text type column. The power of the card is a commonsense evidence:

	`promoTypes` TEXT, -- # Promo Types is a text column in the cards table. It contains a list of promotional types for a card. 	`purchaseUrls` TEXT, -- #This column contains links that navigate to websites where the card can be purchased. 	`rarity` TEXT, -- #The card printing rarity. The rarity of the card printing can be one of the following: mythic, rare, common, or uncommon. #Values Examples: [uncommon, common, rare]

	`setCode` TEXT, -- #The set printing code that the card is from. For example, the set code for the card 'Goblin Electromancer' is 'GRN'. Other possible values for this column include 'PMEI' and 'M11'. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`side` TEXT, -- #The identifier of the card side. Used on cards with multiple faces on the same card. If this value is empty, then it means this card doesn't have multiple faces on the same card. The possible values are: e, b, a, c, d. #Values Examples: [None, a, b]
	`subtypes` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of card subtypes found after em-dash within the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Efreet,Monk, Rebel,Bird, Barbarian,Zombie. #Values Examples: [Human,Cleric, Angel, Bird,Soldier]
	`supertypes` TEXT, -- #The column 'super types' in the table 'cards' of the database 'card_games' represents a list of card supertypes found before em-dash. 	`tcgplayerProductId` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column in the cards table of the card_games database. It contains the TCG player ProductId of each card. Some example values for this column are 'Creature — Centaur Spellshaper', 'Legendary Creature — Elf Warrior', and 'Snow Creature — Wall'. #Values Examples: [Creature — Human Cleric, Creature — Angel, Creature — Bird Soldier]
	`types` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of all card types of the card, including Unâsets and gameplay variants, in the table cards of the card_games database. Example values include Artifact,Creature, Vanguard, and Phenomenon. #Values Examples: [Creature, Instant, Enchantment]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # 'uuid is a text column in cards table. uuid is the universal unique identifier (v5) generated by MTGJSON. Each entry is unique. The example values of uuid are ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d. ' #Values Examples: [00010d56-fe38-5e35-8aed-518019aa36a5, 0001e0d0-2dcd-5640-aadc-a84765cf5fc9, 0003caab-9ff5-5d1a-bc06-976dd0457f19]
	`variations` TEXT, -- #This column is called variations and is of type text. It is a list of unique identifiers for each variation of a card. For example, ebb44251-f81a-502c-8820-028c6accc192, f20e8fe9-a6e0-5d6f-8bd9-50fcb6b245f9, and 028682c8-bfca-5ccb-9935-f8cd0573182d are all variations of a card. #Values Examples: [b7c19924-b4bf-56fc-aa73-f586e940bd42, 8fd4e2eb-3eb4-50ea-856b-ef638fa47f8a, 6adaf14d-43e3-521a-adf1-960c808e5b1a]

CREATE TABLE `foreign_data` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- # 'This column is a unique id number identifying this row of data within the 'foreign data' table in the 'card_games' database.' #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]
	`flavorText` TEXT, -- #The foreign flavor text of the card in the foreign data table. Example values include 「この中のどこかに答えがあるはずよ！」, 魔法の刻印が、彫刻師の道具を狼狩りの武器に変えた。, and 'Quando a história se torna demasiado lúgubre, até mesmo almas boas podem escolher esquecer.' — Shalai, voz da Abundância. #Values Examples: [„Es ist der Wille aller, und meine Hand, die ihn ausführt.", "La voluntad de todos, realizada por mi mano.", « La volonté de tous passe par ma main. »]
	`language` TEXT, -- #The foreign language of card. This column contains text data. Example values include Chinese Traditional, Hebrew, and Russian. #Values Examples: [German, Spanish, French]
	`multiverseid` INTEGER, -- #The foreign multiverse identifier of the card. #Values Examples: [148411, 150317, 149934]
	`name` TEXT, -- #The foreign name of the card in the foreign data table. #Values Examples: [Ausgewählter der Ahnfrau, Elegido de la Antepasada, Élu de l'Ancêtre]
	`text` TEXT, -- #This column represents the foreign text ruling of the card within the context of the foreign data table. The text column is of type text. The foreign text ruling of the card is a description of the card's effect in a language other than English. The example values of this column include: 由你操控的衍生生物得+1/+1並具有警戒異能。, 將目標生物移回其擁有者手上。 其操控者失去1點生命。, Metti sul campo di battaglia due pedine creatura Spirito 1/1 bianche con volare. Guadagni 2 punti vita.. The possible values of this column are not available. #Values Examples: [Erstschlag (Diese Kreatur fügt Kampfschaden vor Kreaturen ohne Erstschlag zu.)
Wenn der Ausgewählte der Ahnfrau ins Spiel kommt, erhältst du 1 Lebenspunkt für jede Karte in deinem Friedhof dazu., Daña primero. (Esta criatura hace daño de combate antes que las criaturas sin la habilidad de dañar primero.)
Cuando el Elegido de la Antepasada entre en juego, ganas 1 vida por cada carta en tu cementerio., Initiative (Cette créature inflige des blessures de combat avant les créatures sans l'initiative.)
Quand l'Élu de l'Ancêtre arrive en jeu, vous gagnez 1 point de vie pour chaque carte dans votre cimetière.]
	`type` TEXT, -- #The foreign type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes. The values in this column are text. Example values include Criatura Lendária — Zumbi Naga, Créature : zombie et gobelin, and Kreatur — Zentaur, Druide, Legende. #Values Examples: [Kreatur — Mensch, Kleriker, Criatura — Clérigo humano, Créature : humain et clerc]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- #This column is a text column named uuid in the table foreign data. It contains the unique identifier for each row in the table. Example values include 6dbb9aab-c2d9-59dd-8ea3-d954c6a29acf, 2896c920-1b81-526a-b211-a931ba0f4a54, d29d4cc6-e3ab-5986-816c-0fdf2da45c8a. #Values Examples: [5f8287b1-5bb6-5f4c-ad17-316a40d5bb0c, 57aaebc1-850c-503d-9f6e-bb8d00d8bf7c, 8ac972b5-9f6e-5cc8-91c3-b9a40a98232e]
	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)
);
CREATE TABLE `legalities` (
	`id` INTEGER, -- #This column is a unique identifier for each legality in the legalities table. #Values Examples: [1, 2, 3]

	`status` TEXT, -- #This column represents the status of a card in the context of legalities table. The possible values for this column are legal, banned, and restricted. #Values Examples: [Legal, Banned, Restricted]
	`uuid` TEXT, -- # This column is a text column in the legalities table of the card_games database. It contains unique identifiers for each row in the table. 	PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
	FOREIGN KEY (`uuid`) REFERENCES `cards`(`uuid`)

CREATE TABLE `sets` (

	`code` TEXT, -- #The set code for the set. #Values Examples: [10E, 2ED, 2XM]
	`isFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table of the 'card_games' database. If the set is only available in foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isForeignOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called is Foreign Only and is of type integer. If the set is available only outside the United States of America. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isNonFoilOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Non Foil Only' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'sets' table. If the set is only available in non-foil. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isOnlineOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Online Only' and is of type 'integer'. If the set is only available in online game variations. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isPartialPreview` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the set is still in preview (spoiled). Preview sets do not have complete data. The data type of this column is integer. #Values Examples: [0, 1]

	`hasNonFoil` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card can be found in non-foil. The value of this column is an integer. 0 means the card cannot be found in non-foil, and 1 means the card can be found in non-foil. #Values Examples: [1, 0]
	`isAlternative` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card is an alternate variation to an original printing. The value of this column is an integer. 0 indicates that the card is not an alternate variation, while 1 indicates that the card is an alternate variation. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isFullArt` INTEGER, -- # 'The column 'is Full Art' in the table 'cards' indicates whether the card has full artwork. The column is of type 'integer'. The value of the column can be either 0 or 1. 0 indicates that the card doesn't have full artwork, while 1 indicates that the card has full artwork.'<|im_sep|> #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isOnlineOnly` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card is only available in online game variations. The values in this column are integers, where 0 indicates that the card is not only available in online game variations, and 1 indicates that the card is only available in online game variations. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isOversized` INTEGER, -- #This column is called is Oversized and is of type integer. It represents whether the card is oversized or not. The value 0 represents that the card is not oversized, while the value 1 represents that the card is oversized. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isPromo` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Promotion' and it is of type 'integer'. It represents whether the card is a promotional printing. The value of 0 means the card is not a promotional printing, while the value of 1 means the card is a promotional printing. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isReprint` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card has been reprinted or not. The value of this column is an integer. If the value is 0, it means that the card has not been reprinted. If the value is 1, it means that the card has been reprinted. #Values Examples: [1, 0]
	`isReserved` INTEGER, -- #If the card is on the Magic: The Gathering Reserved List (opens new window), If the card is on the Magic, it will appear in The Gathering Reserved List #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isStarter` INTEGER, -- #This column indicates whether the card is found in a starter deck such as Planeswalker/Brawl decks. The value of this column is an integer, and 0 indicates that the card is not found in a starter deck, while 1 indicates that the card is found in a starter deck. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`isStorySpotlight` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Story Spotlight' and it is of type 'integer'. It represents whether the card is a Story Spotlight card. 	`isTextless` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Text less' and it is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'cards' table. The column indicates whether the card has a text box or not. 	`isTimeshifted` INTEGER, -- #This column is called 'is Time shifted' and is of type 'integer'. It is a column in the 'cards' table of the 'card_games' database. If the card is 'timeshifted', a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion. #Values Examples: [0, 1]
	`keywords` TEXT, -- #This column is a list of keywords found on the card within the context of the cards table in the card_games database. The column is of type text. Example values include: ['Deathtouch,Delve', 'Flying,Myriad,Vigilance', 'Flying,Mill,Unearth']. #Values Examples: [First strike, Flying, None]
	`layout` TEXT, -- #The type of card layout. For a token card, this will be 'token'. The values of this column include 'leveler', 'vanguard', and 'scheme'. #Values Examples: [normal, aftermath, split]
	`leadershipSkills` TEXT, -- #The leadership Skills column in the cards table is a text column that contains a list of formats the card is legal to be a commander in.
